primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human subject, caught in the flux of a changing and decaying world, seeks stability and must learn to navigate life by orienting themselves toward the unchanging Word of God.

tekstueel_bewijs: We must learn to live with change.
Steer carefully and steadily by it.

object.identificatie: Permanence, stability, and successful navigation of life's changes.
tekstueel_bewijs: a desire for permanence, constancy, stability

zender.identificatie: The Prophet / The Preacher (as the voice of Wisdom)
tekstueel_bewijs: Isaiah spoke... of the transitoriness of all that is on earth
The prophet saw the mighty architecture... unsupported by the Rock of Ages
the man who stands in the heady moment of success
people who have been able to look through their fears

helper.identificatie: The Word of God / The North Star
tekstueel_bewijs: the word of our God shall stand forever
the navigator must test his compass by the reliable constancy of the North Star
helper.rol_van_god: God is instrumentalized as a 'Star' or 'Word' that serves the human navigator.

tegenstander.identificatie: Change, Time, and Decay (The 'Grass' nature of flesh)
tekstueel_bewijs: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: While change is described as 'tempestuous,' it is treated as a condition to be managed rather than a spiritual power (Sin/Death) to be defeated by a Savior.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The historical liberation of Israel from Babylon.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Israelite Slaves
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The historical narrative serves as an exemplar for the modern hearer's psychological state.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Word/North Star → The Hearer ← Time/Change
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Hearer → Living well with change

voorbeelden_god_subject: the spirit of the LORD bloweth upon it
the word of our God shall stand forever
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must learn to live with change.
We want our high and happy moments to go on forever.
Steer carefully and steadily by it.

voorbeelden: We must learn to live with change.
we ought... set ourselves for the time of storm

do you see the answer to the whole thing?

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human desire (longing for stability) and obligation (must learn to live with change), assuming that once the hearer 'sees' the North Star (Savoir), they have the power to steer themselves.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Change) through ~S1 (Anxiety) toward S1 (The Word as a tool for stability).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through human orientation: looking at the 'Star' to manage the 'Sea'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a natural law of physics/biology rather than a theological crisis of mortality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is anthropocentric. The human is the Subject who must 'steer' and 'learn.' God (as the Word) is reduced to a static Helper (a North Star) used by the human Subject to achieve the Object of stability.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the navigator must test his compass by the reliable constancy of the North Star.
Steer carefully and steadily by it.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The exiles in Babylon and 'old sailors' are used as models for how to maintain morale or navigate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who speaks into the exile to create a new reality, not just a 'star' to be looked at.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'steer' better; reliance on one's own ability to keep the 'Star' in sight.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a piece of wisdom literature, but lacks a Gospel-centered narrative hierarchy.
spanning_punten: The text says the Spirit of the Lord blows to wither the grass, but the sermon treats change as a 'law of life' rather than a divine act.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the navigator must test his compass by the reliable constancy of the North Star.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: None; the hearer is assumed to have the power to steer if they have the knowledge.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is equated with 'failure' or 'melancholy' rather than rebellion or death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'how-to' for psychological resilience. The actantial Subject is 'We' and the Object is 'Stability.' God is a passive 'Helper' (the Star).

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The human is the navigator; God is the map.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God is the Navigator who carries the helpless 'grass' into eternity.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Steer by the Star,' use 'The Word of God has taken hold of you, and He will not let you go even when the grass withers.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must 'learn to live with change.'
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'Word' is not just a star to look at, but an active power that 'stands' when we fall.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Word *gives* strength to the weary (Isaiah 40:29-31).

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Death and Decay as enemies that only a Resurrection can solve.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a 'Heavy Opponent,' the 'Helper' remains a mere tool.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The secondary program (how to live) has swallowed the primary program (how God saves).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God's Word creates life from nothing. 2. Therefore, we can rest in change.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful and psychologically insightful, but it leaves the hearer in the driver's seat. To move toward grace, the preacher must make the 'Word' an active Subject that saves, rather than a passive object to be used for navigation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'North Star' is a brilliant metaphor; actantially, it reveals a deistic structure where God is a fixed, non-acting point.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Isaiah 40 usually emphasizes God's active comfort ('Comfort ye'); this sermon focuses on human 'longing' for comfort.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'musical' and 'lovely' language, the 'engine' of the sermon is powered by human effort (steering).

appendices.notities: The sermon leans heavily on the 'Moral Influence' model of the atonement/salvation.
